冒.definition: to emit; to give off; to send out (or up, forth); to brave; to face; (bound form) reckless; to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc); to feign; (literary) to cover

冒充.definition: to feign; to pretend to be; to pass oneself off as

冒出來.definition: to emerge; to pop up; to spring forth; to appear from nowhere

冒名頂替.definition: to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate; to pose under a false name

冒天下之大不韙.pinyin: mao4 tian1 xia4 zhi1 da4 bu4 wei3
冒天下之大不韙.definition: see 冒大不韙|冒大不韪[mao4 da4 bu4 wei3]

冒昧.definition: bold; presumptuous; to take the liberty of

冒火.definition: to get angry; to burn with rage

冒煙.definition: to discharge smoke; to fume with rage

冒險.definition: to take risks; to take chances; foray; adventure

冒險主義.definition: adventurism (a left-wing error against Mao's line during the 1930s)

冒頂.definition: (mining) roof fall; to have the roof cave in

冒領.definition: to obtain by impersonation; to falsely claim as one's own

冒頭.definition: to emerge; to crop up; a little more than

冒題.definition: writing style in which the main subject is not introduced initially (opposite: 破題|破题[po4ti2])
